context.p: A moving average trend line smooths fluctuations in the data, making the pattern more clearly.

The moving average is the average of a fixed number of consecutive values in a time series. The length of time for the fixed number of elements is called the period. The line through these averages is the trend line. Strong fluctuations will be weaker. Usually, it takes some experimenting to find a suitable period.
This line has no formula and also the R-squared value cannot be calculated. There are other methods available for quality evaluation.

The following example is about the price of a share for 20 days. The moving average is calculated for 3 days. The first value for the moving average can only be calculated on day 3 and the value is the average of day 1, 2, and 3. The next value on day 4 is the average of the values on day 2, 3, and 4. And so on.

step.cmd: Open the practice file and select worksheet MovingAverage
Select at Trendline Options: Moving Average with Period 3.
Change the chart title in Share prices.
Add Axis titles and change title Y-axis in Price and title X-axis in Day.

result.p: You can clearly see that the trend line smooths the values.
